title: Why The Big Bang Theory is about to explode
text:

Wed, Jul 22, 2015, 19:24 BST - UK Markets closed Why The Big Bang Theory is about to explode By Lauren Davidson | Telegraph – 5 minutes ago 102.60 -0.70 
America's favourite TV show is about to crack the Chinese online market, which will overshadow its galactic performance in the US 
The Big Bang Theory, already America's favourite TV show , is about to reach extraterrestrial levels of popularity as it becomes the first US television programme to broadcast legally on Chinese internet under the country's new regulations. 
Last year, China clamped down on foreign content limiting the number of shows that can be aired and implementing tougher censorship on imported media which resulted in the removal of The Big Bang Theory, NCIS, The Good Wife and The Practice from the Chinese web. 
After pre-watching the latest episodes of the sitcom, the State Administration of Press, Publication, Radio, Film and Television, China's media regulator, has agreed to allow the eighth series to be shown on Sohu (although earlier seasons will still be unavailable). 
Although the Big Bang Theory is already the most popular television show in the US, and even has an official Lego set , its move to China marks a turning point for the CBS comedy. 
The Big Bang Theory even has its own official Lego set 
The show consistently racks up series average audience sizes of almost 20m in the US, almost double the reach of its closest competitor , Modern Family. 
Even US reruns of the programme attract more viewers than new episodes of Parks and Recreation, Community and The Mindy Project combined. 
In the UK, roughly 2m people watch The Big Bang Theory, which follows the personal lives of theoretical physicist Sheldon and group of nerdy friends. 
That pales in comparison to the magnitude of its new audience in China , which has the largest online video market in the world, with 450m viewers. That is expected to grow to 700m by next year. 
The show had racked up a staggering 1.3bn views on Sohu, the Chinese internet conglomerate, before it was taken offline. 
The online video industry in China generated revenues of 23.97bn yuan (£2.48bn) in 2014, a rise of 76pc from the previous year, and is expected to almost quadruple in size by 2018, reaching £9.29bn. 
Sohu, the new legal home of The Big Bang Theory in China, has more than 250m unique monthly visitors. Chinese internet users spend a third of their online time , a total of 5.7bn hours, watching videos. 
Other media and technology companies have been desperate to get their hands on the Chinese market. Netflix (Xetra: 552484 - news ) 's share price jumped to an all-time high , breaking through $600, following reports that the film streaming service was about to launch in China. 
Uber chief executive Travis Kalanick recently announced that China, a crucial smartphone market , is the company's "number one priority" and unveiled a $1bn budget for the region this year. 
The Big Bang Theory has undoubtedly enjoyed enormous success in the US, but it looks like its biggest bang is yet to come.
